Name: Taxi Divers, Separate Road Test
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York in relation to requiring a separate road test for taxi drivers, to be administered by the Taxi and Limousine Commission
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section one. Section 19-505 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision b-1 to read as follows:
      b-1. No taxicab driver's license, other than the renewal of such a license, may be issued unless the applicant has passed a road test administered by the commission, intended to demonstrate an applicant's ability to drive a taxicab under typical conditions. Such road test shall consist of, at a minimum, three simulated passenger trips to a requested destination within the city and shall not supersede or be considered to serve as a substitute for any test required pursuant to state law.
      ï¿½2.	This local law shall take effect immediately.




LS#198
03/09/98
